message: I created https://gff.heroku.com to scratch an itch and have an excuse to do sth. with redis. You can login with your github account and then set detail what should appear in your feed in the settings.
Not all github feed events are implemented, yet. But it is already pretty usable I think.
I hadn't seen that, and it's really neat!
i think it is down since i submitted my username and api key and now it says internal error...
Neat, Back In The Day I just used feedsifter.com ... but then I usually didn't do anything very complicated.
I won't be trying it without OAuth but thanks for mentioning http://hckrnews.com/

@bat Storing the API token in a cookie seemed like the faster and simpler solution for what the app does, as I just wanted a thin filter layer for the Github feed. But I agree with you here. OAuth is one of the things I consider adding next.
@italiano40 the site is up. Does the problem still persist for you?
@mrtazz I do not doubt your good intentions, but then I don't pass my API key out either.
@mrtazz I'm in the same camp. Looking forward to an OAuth implementation so I can check it out :)
@pfhawkins, @bobthecow so OAuth just made it top of the list, I guess. :)
this is what i get when i try to access your site http://i.imgur.com/GTTvl.png
Since I doubt this will be the last time this happens I'm going to create an extra github account.
I started to implement OAuth yesterday. However there doesn't seem to be a way to get the newsfeed via OAuth. So maybe I need to figure out another way to get the events.
I just went ahead and signed up.
Oh, that's right, the newsfeed url contains the auth token.
suggestion to github: make the feed use a separate token, but keep the old one working for backward compatibility
@bat thanks. Just being able to get the feed with the OAuth access token would be enough IMHO. Until then I'll work on improving the UI.
